Description: Papyrus, written with black ink, legal document dated to Year 20 of Ptolemy VI Philometor and Cleopatra II - Loan of money with land as surety.
Curator's comments: This document is part of a family archive associated with Panas, son of Espmetis, a mortuary priest and moneylender. Panas’ archive contains documents from his own business (between 180-157 BC), his father Espmetis’ business (between 239-223 BC) and Panas’ wife Tathoytis (from 175 BC). Papyri from Panas’ archive are held by multiple institutions, the British Museum holdings are: EA10388; EA10532; EA10556,1-4; EA10557; EA10612; EA10613; EA10614; EA10615,1-3; EA10670,1-7; EA10823 and EA10824. Panas also appears in documentation from other family archives, including that of Pechytes, son of Pchorchonsis, and what is known as the ‘Anonymous’ family archive. For a full list of associated documents and their relationship with Panas: https://www.trismegistos.org/arch/archives/pdf/446.pdf https://www.trismegistos.org/arch/detail.php?quick=446 P.W. Pestman, 1995. ‘A family archive which changes history’, in S.P. Vleeming Hundred-gated Thebes: acts of a colloquium on Thebes and the Theban area in the Graeco-Roman period. B. Muhs, 2005. Tax receipts, taxpayers, and taxes in early Ptolemaic Thebes. Published in: I. Regulski (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 202, 204-5
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43340) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43340)
Muhs 2014/2015 / More Papyri from the Archive of Panas Son of Espemetis (pp.91-2)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
